page.title: 06FOLKLORE IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: The area is famous for its connection with the Pendle Witches.In l6l2 two families, the Demdikes and the Chattox, were tried at Lancaster Assizes and six people were eventually hanged for witchcraft. Alice Nutter, also tried but found not guilty, is buried in St. Mary's Churchyard, Newchurch.The Eye of God in the tower of this Church is meant to ward off evil spirits. On Hallow'een people visit the area because of its connection with the witches. On Good Friday l652 George Fox had a vision on Pendle Hill which led to the founding of the Quaker Movement and it is now the custom to walk to the top of Pendle Hill on this day. For over 20 years a local family have held a Garden Party at their home to raise funds for St. Mary's Church.
